rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Role: Crewmate
Your current game state is:

Game Context:
Round 1
Location: GameLocation.LOC_MEDBAY
Seen Actions:
You saw Wojtek doing task Start the coffee maker in the cafeteria when you were in Cafeteria

You saw Mateusz moved to Medbay from Cafeteria when you were in Medbay
You saw Nemo moved to Medbay from Cafeteria when you were in Medbay
Players in room with you: [Mateusz, Nemo]
Your plan:
**Plan for Norbert (Crewmate)**

1. **Move to Medbay**: Start by moving from the Cafeteria to Medbay to run diagnostics, as this task has a time constraint of 2 turns left to finish.

2. **Run Diagnostics in Medbay**: Once in Medbay, immediately perform the diagnostics task to ensure it gets completed within the time limit.

3. **Evaluate Situation**: After completing the task in Medbay, assess the surroundings for any suspicious activity or dead bodies. If everything seems clear, consider moving to the next task location based on the remaining objectives.

4. **Prepare for Discussion Phase**: If any suspicious behavior is observed or if a body is found, be ready to report and discuss during the upcoming Discussion Phase.

This plan prioritizes completing a time-sensitive task while remaining vigilant for any signs of impostors.

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Response prompt: 
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Response prompt: 
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Response prompt: 
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor

- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions

- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor

- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions

- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win

- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies

- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Plan prompt:

This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

3. **Assess Situation**: After completing the task in Medbay, I will take a moment to observe my surroundings and check for any suspicious activity or players. If I notice anything unusual, I will consider reporting it or calling an emergency meeting.

4. **Plan Next Move**: Depending on the situation and the tasks remaining, I will decide whether to move to another room (like Electrical for the power routing task) or stay in Medbay to gather more information.

This plan keeps me focused on completing my tasks while remaining vigilant for any potential impostor activity.

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions

- Players can move between rooms

- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks

- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Action prompt:
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Response prompt: 
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

rounds.prompt:
Points prompt: 
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game

Response prompt: 
This is a text-based social deduction game where players explore a virtual house while trying to complete objectives. The game has two phases:
1. Action Phase: Players can move between rooms and perform actions
2. Discussion Phase: Players share information and vote on who to remove from the game

Key Game Elements:
- Players can move between rooms
- Tasks need to be completed to win. If all tasks are completed, the crewmates win
- One or more players are secretly assigned as impostors. Your role is either a crewmate or an impostor
- Impostors can eliminate crewmates, and both crewmates and impostors can report dead bodies
- Crewmates complete the tasks and impostors can pretend doing tasks
- Crewmates and impostors can call emergency meetings to discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- After each elimination, players must discuss and vote on who to eject from the game
- The game continues until tasks are completed or impostors eliminate enough crewmates to win

Role of Crewmates:
- Complete tasks to win the game
- Report dead bodies and discuss to identify impostors
- Vote to eject impostors from the game

Role of Impostors:
- Eliminate crewmates to win the game
- Blend in with crewmates to avoid being identified
- Vote to eject crewmates from the game
